text: Georg Christian Unger (25 May 1743 in Bayreuth â€“ 20 February 1799 in Berlin) was a German architect. He was a pupil of the architect Carl von Gontard and served for Frederick II of Prussia. He created a lot of buildings in Potsdam, e.g. Brandenburg Gate, and Berlin, e.g. at the Gendarmenmarkt.answers.com == References == Category:1743 births Category:1799 deaths Category:German architects Category:People from Bavaria
title: Georg Christian Unger
